intro: Lychnis siegeri, commonly known as the Sieger's campion, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks. Its ornamental value has made it a popular choice for garden cultivation in temperate regions.
